subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: what you hear is what you get

Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

LOL!

  ----- Original Message ----- 
  From: Frank Sumption 
  To: EVP-ITC=
@yahoogroups.com 
  Sent: Friday, May 15, 2009 2:14 PM
  Subject: Re: [EVP-=
ITC] Re: what you hear is what you get





  I always listen to EVP wiht m=
y ears!--I know--alien humor.



  On Fri, May 15, 2009 at 1:24 PM, April A=
bercrombie <april@...> wrote:





    I always li=
sten to EVP's with high quality headphones.

    In the "tomorrow let you k=
now" EVP, I do hear something....just can't be sure that it is a voice. I d=
oes have a cadence similar to someone speaking, but it could just as easily=
 be something present in the environment-a natural background noise. There =
is no way for me to tell for certain as it is just too feint. I can't make =
out any clear words. Sure-I could probably matrix some in, but that is all =
it would be.

    For an EVP to be considered proof positive of spirit comm=
unication by the community at large, it has to be clear enough that many pe=
ople hear the same thing, without hints or coaxing. If you have to have hig=
h quality devices to make it out, it just isn't good enough. That does not =
mean it isn't a true EVP, just that it isn't good enough to stand as eviden=
ce.

    As for the whistle, it sounded like feedback to me as well, but I =
will have to take you word for it that you were no where near any other ele=
ctronics or EMF's that could contribute to feedback. Even so, if I am tryin=
g to remain unbiased and objective, there is no way for me to say this is a=
 spirit, without personally being with you when you caught it. The only thi=
ng I can still say about it is could be, but for me it is non conclusive.

=
    If someone does not hear what you are hearing, try to remain objective =
and just understand that it isn't personal. You have to understand that wit=
h just these recordings alone, there is no way to scientifically prove what=
 you have recorded is spirit communication. If you could get consistent, in=
telligent question and answer recordings, then you would be alot closer.

 =
   Here again, we are back to the "So what?" thing. You don't HAVE to prove=
 anything scientifically, unless you want others to completely believe in y=
our evidence.

    The theory that is being kicked around is that some EVP'=
s are personal, and only meant for the person recording them to hear. If th=
is is the case, no matter how clear something is to you, others may not hea=
r it.

    April


      ----- Original Message ----- 
      From: James W.=
 Hyslope 
      To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com 
      Sent: Friday, May 15, 20=
09 12:02 PM
      Subject: [EVP-ITC] Re: what you hear is what you get


  =
    Okay, I can respect that. If you can't hear them then it must be either=
 mechanical (sound card or headphones)or maybe your hearing has loss in tho=
se frequencies....Some of these are not very clear or loud enough too. But =
many will depend on your computer sound card & your headphones. I have let =
an older man listen (in his late 60's) and he has heard most all of the aud=
io. Same with a few guys at work. Some hear them right away, and others can=
't until I loop the actually EVP for a few tries. I personally use a Dell L=
atitude D430 to hear these. I can hear some on my cell phone. Headphones ar=
e a must....or you won't hear anything either way. *But some can be heard o=
n cell phone without headphones. The conversion to MP3 has also caused some=
 loss, but I am still able to hear them when I review from this site (but I=
 have the repetive hearing syndrome in this area no doubt). Although I do h=
ave some disbelief (shock) that a few of these are not discernable. Go back=
 and listen to "tomorrow let you know" is in a gruffy-robotic melodic tone =
at the very end but with higher natural volume. And if you couldn't hear th=
e whistle...I would suggest the need to remove the cotton from the ear :) A=
s for feedback.....feedback from what? I only had one recorder working here=
. I would rather hear someone say "I" made the whistle....that would be mor=
e understandable. And is very true....if someone "tells" the group that THI=
S is supposed to be what WAS said, then is very difficult to clear the mind=
 to hear it any other way. Kinda like trying to hum another song while a di=
fferent one is playing :) --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "April Abercrombi=
e" <april@...> wrote:
      >
      > Here's the thing though - if you put =
something out there, and ask people to listen to it, your inviting opinions=
. Some will be in agreement, and some won't, no matter what.
      > 
     =
 > If EVP messages are for the one that recorded them, then it shouldn't su=
rprise you, or offend you, if someone doesn't hear the same thing you do. I=
f you don't want contrary opinions on something, then you should not give p=
eople the chance to critique.
      > 
      > Now I could see if someone f=
lat out said your recordings were all trash, period. You would have every r=
ight to be angry, but no one is saying that, at least I am not saying that.=

      > 
      > I just stated that I did not hear what James heard, and t=
hough I wasn't going to say he doesn't have anything, I can't say that he d=
oes either.
      > 
      > ----- Original Message ----- 
      > From: Fr=
ank Sumption 
      > To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com 
      > Sent: Friday, Ma=
y 15, 2009 11:00 AM
      > Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: what you hear is wha=
t you get
      > 
      > 
      > 
      > 
      > 
      > 
      > Yea=
h, and we've all heard the thing about opinions.
      > 
      > F-s
     =
 > 
      > 
      > On Fri, May 15, 2009 at 10:53 AM, April Abercrombie <a=
pril@...> wrote:
      > 
      > 
      > 
      > 
      > 
      > Noone=
 is saying what they hear is law, just their opinion.
      > 
      > ----=
- Original Message ----- 
      > From: Frank Sumption 
      > To: EVP-ITC=
@yahoogroups.com 
      > Sent: Friday, May 15, 2009 10:43 AM
      > Subje=
ct: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: what you hear is what you get
      > 
      > 
     =
 > 
      > Soooo, everyone hears different, and personally I find it offen=
sive when someone presumes to tell everyone what another researhcer's voice=
s really say. I think EVP messages are for the one that recorded thmm, to e=
veryone else it's non-sense, except there's enough to show that there is a =
phenomenon. 
      > 
      > I get really tired of these self proclaimed e=
xperts trying to dicate what's acceptable.
      > 
      > Frank-S
      >=
 
      > 
      > On Fri, May 15, 2009 at 10:04 AM, Rick <rasterer@...> wr=
ote:
      > 
      > 
      > 
      > 
      > I opened your folder and e=
xamined all your files.
      > 
      > Here are my opinions (I have trunc=
ated the file names due to laziness):
      > 
      > ahh_mmm noises, no s=
peech
      > call_us noises, no speech
      > cal_us (enhanced) several l=
istenings: pixelated, no speech
      > compare_panasonic noises, no speech=

      > compare_sony noises, no speech
      > first_epv noises, no speech=

      > good_whistle noises, no speech (maybe feedback)
      > hey_can no=
ises, no speech
      > hey_whats noises, no speech
      > I_hit noises, n=
o speech
      > important_date noises, no speech
      > keep_moving sever=
al listenings: Hellalal see woobeh 
      > laugh_evp noises, no speech
   =
   > lets_wait several listenings: noises, no speech
      > maybe_gun nois=
es, no speech
      > miss_you noises, no speech
      > my_question severa=
l listenings: no da lee
      > oh_ noises, no speech
      > something sev=
eral listenings: noises, no speech
      > that_mans noises, no speech
    =
  > that's_jim noises, no speech
      > this_one several listenings: noise=
s, no speech
      > tomorrow noises, no speech
      > 
      > The ones t=
hat took several listenings I thought I might hear words in, so I examined =
those several times. Sometimes I could sort of hear something that sort of =
sounded like what you suggested, but I could also hear it in other ways, or=
 not at all.
      > 
      > So my suggestion to you, if you want to get l=
ess subjective conjuctures or simply less affirmations of your own interpre=
tations, is to post the future ones without labels. The labels you give can=
 influence the listeners: when you have a sound that could be several thing=
s, and you note that it sounded like "keep it moving", the listener can fin=
d it nearly impossible to try NOT to hear what you heard, and so not be abl=
e to give a fresh perspecive to help your research methods. 
      > 
     =
 > 
      > 
      > --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "James W. Hyslope" <cl=
ockdryve@> wrote:
      > >
      > > Go to my Folder in the files section =
"Jim's RR-DR60 EVP's" and see if anyone (needs to) decide "FOR ME" and let =
me know if I am of the serious type. In my short time I have gathered enoug=
h "proof" for myself that this method works for ME. And from what I have se=
en from others that I have let "listen" to my files (friends) I am blessed =
with the "ability" to HEAR very low audio artifacts....so this will help me=
 in my RESEARCH. And I am OPEN to any help to reach my goals (or help other=
s) with their goals. Have fun people. On a HAPPIER NOTE :) I was lucky enou=
gh to catch the RR-DR60 taking a nap yesterday....it missed a few evp's rea=
l close together (in a 5 second clip) the Sony ICD-B7 heard a male use a di=
fferent number than what I used. I said 16 (my earlier age I was saying in =
recorder) and the male evp said 13....then a female laughs. All this was mi=
ssed by the DR60 (except my 16 was recorded in both recorders) BUT then the=
 DR60 "caught" the B7 "napping" at near the end of the 5 second clip....the=
 DR60 heard "let me out" in a clear (quite) males voice. So this is very pr=
omising piece of evidence for me. **those 2 recordings have been uploaded t=
o my folder. I will include an Olympus W-10 (soon as arrives), Panasonic RR=
-US360 (when I think to grab it) and my RR-QR80 to go with my RR-QR100, and=
 one more (can't remember what brand-model of this last---due to arrive) LO=
L. I need to build a multiple mounting devise to aid in putting these into =
tandem service. Then I think I will use my Olympus DS-50 as my "Control" re=
corder....by using it on the HQ settings. I am looking to build a "subsonic=
" microphone also (something to do with those low "booms" that I have notic=
ed lead or follow many evp's). So I look forward to any ideas. Falure is NO=
T an option. Haha.....
      > >
      >
